intro: Cronquistianthus desmophyllus, commonly known as the silverleaf mistletoe, is a parasitic plant belonging to the family Viscaraceae. It is characterized by its evergreen, leathery leaves that are covered in a dense, silvery-white layer of fine hairs. The plant produces small, inconspicuous white or greenish flowers that are typically pollinated by insects. Its berries are red or yellow and contain seeds that are dispersed by birds. This species is often found growing on the branches of deciduous trees in temperate regions.
